pullRequest.body:
general properties:

- make `is_transcendental_of_subsingleton` a `nontriviality` lemma
- `IsAlgebraic.[of_]ringHom_of_comp_eq`, `isAlgebraic_ringHom_iff_of_comp_eq`: generalize the similar result for `algHom`
- `Transcendental.of_tower_top[_of_injective]`: negation of `IsAlgebraic.tower_top[_of_injective]`
- `algebraicIndependent_of_finite_type'`: `Type` version of `algebraicIndependent_of_finite'`, which will be used later

properties on polynomials:

- `Transcendental.aeval_of_transcendental`, `Transcendental.of_aeval`, `transcendental_aeval_iff`, `IsAlgebraic.of_aeval_of_transcendental`: `f(r) : A` is transcendental over `R` if and only if `r : A` and `f : R[X]` are both transcendental over `R`
- move `MvPolynomial.transcendental_X` to earlier file
- `MvPolynomial.transcendental_supported_polynomial_aeval_X[_iff]`: `f(X_i)` is transcendental over `R[X_j | j \in S]` if and only if `i \notin S` and `f : R[X]` is transcendental over `R`
- `MvPolynomial.transcendental_polynomial_aeval_X[_iff]`: `f(X_i)` is transcendental over `R` if and only if `f : R[X]` is transcendental over `R`
- `MvPolynomial.transcendental_supported_X[_iff]`: `X_i` is transcendental over `R[X_j | j \in S]` if and only if `i \notin S`
- `MvPolynomial.algebraicIndependent_polynomial_aeval_X`: `f_i(X_i)` is algebraically independent over `R` if each `f_i : R[X]` is transcendental over `R`

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Could someone looking at compile error introduced by commit https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18433/commits/967933442168b322716601e4f24770f8edc1cdd7 ? I think this proof is correct, but in my computer, the proof just stuck at the last `exact` forever. When I commit the code to github, the CI just said `Lean exited with code 137`, google tells me it means "out of memory". If this cannot be fixed, then I'll revert that commit and it concludes this PR.
Fixed by extracting intermediate results as lemmas ðŸ˜…

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I think by the [naming convention](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html) this should be `of_transcendental_of_aeval`, as "The hypotheses are listed in the order they appear, not reverse order".
I see. Do you think it's better to switch the order of `hf` and `H`?
Seeing as it's a function of `IsAlgebraic` I think that makes sense, yes
Done.

I think these would be better with [`RingHomClass`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Ring/Hom/Defs.html#RingHomClass) and [`RingEquivClass`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Ring/Equiv.html#RingEquivClass). Additionally, perhaps `h` should be mentioned in the name - it seems quite important for the theorem
Let me try.
Done.
Should this be `@[simp]`?
I'm not sure about this...
Done.
I'm unsure about the `tower_top` in all of these, although I see it's preexisting so I think it's fine for this PR
Yes that name is not quite accurate.

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/Algebraic[Independent]): some more results on transcendental and algebraically independent
